original_title: Sri Lanka stocks up, but turnover low
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Thursday, CSE data showed. However, turnover was at a low 430 million.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.09 percent, or 10.15 points, at 10,713.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.30 percent, or 9.12 points, at 3,065.
The banks sector contributed the most to the day’s turnover, with 118 million, and the food, beverage and tobacco sector contributed 116 million.
Market participants said in addition to the holiday mood, investors were also holding back until Dec 12, when an announcement about the IMF second tranche is expected.
Banks attracted most of today’s meagre investor interest, followed by the big caps, they pointed out.
Sampath Bank Plc was up at 71.20, and Commercial Bank of Ceylon was up at 78.10.
Melstacorp Plc saw its shares up at 82.10, while Distilleries Company of Sri Lanka Plc up at 28.30.
John Keells Holdings Plc saw continued foreign interest (down at 191.50). (Colombo/Dec7/2023).
